nodes.text: @JohnThomT @TheSpec He doesn't "get to decide".\n\nHe made a statement. And someone reported on it. If people listen to his conclusion that's up to them.
@LillyPadd13 @TheSpec His attitude is that he does get to decide. Read it. It is not a suggestion. It is a "We must do this". No discussion ... it must be this way.

@TheSpec So basically we must make the majority of students feel less safe and arguably will be less safe, because a group in one community feel less safe .... but why is that the case. SRO reduces crime and bullying. Why does Lawrence Hill get to decide for others? https://t.co/IYSWqEb5H8
Police presence feeds into the ‘school-to-prison pipeline,’ #HamOnt author Lawrence Hill says\n\nhttps://t.co/XZWF10cqSO
